official_title: A bill to amend title 23, United States Code, to provide that States shall establish certain requirements respecting all-terrain vehicles as a condition to the receipt of funds for highway construction.
short_title: National All Terrain Vehicle Safety Act of 1983

summary.text: National All Terrain Vehicle Safety Act of 1985 - Conditions Federal approval of a State's highway project plans upon enactment of State laws which: (1) set a minimum age of 16 for operators of all-terrain vehicles; (2) require an operator's license for all-terrain vehicles; (3) condition the issuance of an operator's license upon completion of a training course in the safe operation of all-terrain vehicles; and (4) prohibit the operation of all-terrain vehicles on roads and highways in the State.

titles.title: National All Terrain Vehicle Safety Act of 1983

A bill to amend title 23, United States Code, to provide that States shall establish certain requirements respecting all-terrain vehicles as a condition to the receipt of funds for highway construction.
